items.description: Workflow versions that match the items in the filter

accessoryFiles.description: Any supplemental files required by the workflow (e.g. other workflows that are imported or included by the main workflow

name.description: The name of the workflow associated with this workflow version

outputs.description: The outputs from the workflow that should be provisioned by Víðarr.

parameters.description: The user-defined labels that must be supplied with this job. This cannot be modified after the initial creation of the workflow.

workflow.description: Instructions of what to run with the workflow, written in the WorkflowLanguage

items.description: Workflows that match the items in the filter

recursive.description: Whether the workflows that consumed the output of the filtered workflow should be dumped as well. This can be toggled for copy-out, but unload is always recursive

post.description: Get the workflow, workflow version, and workflow run data for the items selected by the filter. If 'recursive' is true, the output will also include any workflow runs that consumed the output of a workflow run selected by the filter.

requestBody.description:
The `filter` object contains two arguments: `type` and a value. Valid `type` options are: ["and", "not", "or", "vidarr-analysis-id", "vidarr-completed-after", "vidarr-external-id", "vidarr-external-provider", "vidarr-last-submitted-after", "vidarr-workflow-id", "vidarr-workflow-name", "vidarr-workflow-run-id"]. The value is type-dependent; options are described in the UnloadFilterX options in the Schemas section below.

For example, unloading by workflow run ID would look like this: { "type": "vidarr-workflow-run-id", "id": ["list of one or more workflow run IDs"] } .

The "and", "not" or "or" filter types accept an array of filters, which enables combining filter conditions.

200.description: A copy of the selected workflow, workflow version, and workflow run data

get.description: Get information for a provisioned-out file from a completed workflow by the file's unique identifier.

200.description: File was found.

404.description: The file identifier was unknown to this server.

post.description: Add workflow and workflow run data to the Vidarr database.

200.description: Workflows and workflow runs were added to the Vidarr database

400.description: Workflows, workflow versions, or workflow runs are malformed or in conflict with existing data

507.description: Too many load/unload requests; try again later

post.description: Add workflow and workflow run data to the Vidarr database without workflow run or analysis hashes.

200.description: Workflows and workflow runs were added to the Vidarr database

400.description: Workflows, workflow versions, or workflow runs are malformed or in conflict with existing data

507.description: Too many load/unload requests; try again later

get.description: Fetch current in-flight and max in-flight data for all workflows

200.description: The current max-in-flight information for all workflows

post.description: Fetch updated analyis provenance from the server. Analyis provenance is served incrementally, so a response contains the parameters necessary to get the remaining data. If the epoch changes, the client should discard all previous data and assume the server will resend all data. For the initial request, the client should initialise the epoch to zero.

analysisTypes.description: The type of analysis desired. The default is only files.

epoch.description: The epoch number returned in the last request or zero for the first request.

includeParameters.description: If true, the workflow parameters will be returned.

timestamp.description: The timestamp returned in the previous request or zero for this first request.

versionPolicy.description: The type of external ID versions that should be returned; this value affects the type of the returned object.

items.description: The version keys that should be returned; if empty, all version keys are allowed

requestBody.description: This defines the search space the client is interested in. The client is responsible for maintaining state between requests.

epoch.description: A server token that should be included in the next request. If the epoch returned does not match the epoch requested, the client should delete all previous data.

results.description: The workflow run information. If a workflow run has been previously returned, as matched by ID, it has been modified and should replace the existing record.

timestamp.description: A server token that should be included in the next request. This value should not match the request.

200.description: The new or modified workflow runs from the server.

get.description: Get the list of recovery failures from the most recent boot of Vidarr that have not yet been deleted, i.e. outstanding failures.

200.description: List of outstanding recovery failures.

post.description: Retries failed workflow that are stuck in the provision-out stage. The workflow run identifiers can be supplied or null can be used to restart all workflow runs.

200.description: The workflow runs that were queued for retry.

post.description: Re-do provision-out on a finished workflow run with another output provisioner.

200.description: TODO WRITE ME.

post.summary: Redoes provisioning out with a new provisioner

get.description: Get information about a completed workflow run by the workflow run's unique identifier.

200.description: Workflow run was found.

404.description: The workflow run identifier was unknown to this server.

get.description: Get information about all workflow runs that are not yet completed

200.description: Status information for all workflow runs that are not yet completed

get.summary: Get status of all active workflow runs

delete.description: Delete a failed or waiting workflow run using the workflow run's unique identifier

200.description: The workflow run was deleted

404.description: No active workflow run was found for the given identifier

409.description: The workflow run cannot be deleted because it is actively running

get.description: Get the information about a workflow run that is not yet completed. This also updates the workflow run's lastAccessed time.

200.description: The status of the workflow run is available.

404.description: The workflow run identifier is unknown to this server.

get.summary: Get status of a workflow run

post.description: Submits a workflow run. If the workflow run has not been previously started, this will start the worflow run. If previously started, this will provide the ID of the workflow run.

200.description: The workflow run request was successfully submitted.

400.description: The workflow run request does not match the workflow definition.

409.description: The workflow run request is in conflict with an existing workflow run on the server.

get.description: List the targets available on this server.

200.description: All available targets

post.description: Remove selected workflow runs and any workflow runs that consumed their output from the database and download them to the configured 'unloadDirectory'. Any unfinished workflow runs that consumed the selected workflow runs will enter a failed state but will not be removed directly.

requestBody.description:
The `filter` object contains two arguments: `type` and a value. Valid `type` options are: ["and", "not", "or", "vidarr-analysis-id", "vidarr-completed-after", "vidarr-external-id", "vidarr-external-provider", "vidarr-last-submitted-after", "vidarr-workflow-id", "vidarr-workflow-name", "vidarr-workflow-run-id"]. The value is type-dependent; options are described in the UnloadFilterX options in the Schemas section below.

For example, unloading by workflow run ID would look like this: { "type": "vidarr-workflow-run-id", "id": ["list of one or more workflow run IDs"] } .

The "and", "not" or "or" filter types accept an array of filters, which enables combining filter conditions. Definitionally, 'recursive' is true

200.description: An object detailing the name of the file in the configured 'unloadDirectory' where the unloaded data is stored (this data has been removed from the Vidarr database) and the IDs of the workflow runs which have been removed.

507.description: Too many load/unload requests; try again later

get.description: Get information about a provisioned-out file from a completed workflow run by the workflow run URL's unique identifier.

200.description: URL was found.

404.description: The ID was unknown to this server.

post.description: Update external IDs with new equivalences in bulk.

newVersionKey.description: The version key to add. If adding a new version of the same type, this might be the same as the old version key.

oldVersionKey.description: The version key to search for. An external identifier will be updated if this key is present and matches the per record value

provider.description: The provider to be used for all identifiers

add.description: The new value to insert using the new version key.

old.description: The existing value that must be present as a value under the old version key to permit the new value to be inserted.

200.description: The number of records that were updated.

delete.description: Deactivate a workflow. This does not stop inflight actions from using this workflow. It merely stops it from being available in the workflow catalogue.

200.description: The workflow was successfully disabled. It can be reactivated using the POST method.

404.description: The workflow is unknown to this server

get.description: Get the configuration for a workflow.

isActive.description: Whether the workflow can be used for executing new jobs.

labels.description: The user-defined labels that must be supplied with this job.

maxInFlight.description: The maximum number of instances of this job that may be running at any given time.

200.description: The workflow is known.

post.description: Create a workflow. If the workflow already exists, update its max-in-flight. If a workflow was previously deactivated, this reactivates that workflow.

parameters.description: Name of workflow to add or update
parameters.name: name

labels.description: The user-defined labels that must be supplied with this job. This cannot be modified after the initial creation of the workflow.

maxInFlight.description: The maximum number of instances of this job that may be running at any given time.

requestBody.description: The configuration parameters for a workflow.

200.description: The workflow has been created.

parameters.description: Include the workflow version definition files in the response? (true/false)
parameters.name: includeDefinitions

accessoryFiles.description: Map of the name of the subworkflow definition file and the contents of the subworkflow definition file (only included if requested in the query)

workflow.description: Text of the file that is run for this workflow version (only included if requested in the query)

200.description: The workflow version.

404.description: No workflow with the given name and version was found.

post.description: Create a workflow version. The workflow must previously have been created.

accessoryFiles.description: Any supplemental files required by the workflow (e.g. other workflows that are imported or included by the main workflow

outputs.description: The outputs from the workflow that should be provisioned by Víðarr.

parameters.description: The user-defined labels that must be supplied with this job. This cannot be modified after the initial creation of the workflow.

workflow.description: The text of what gets run in this workflow version. Can be a WDL script or similar.

requestBody.description: The configuration parameters for a workflow version.

200.description: The workflow version already exists.

201.description: The workflow version has been created.

404.description: No workflow with the given name was found.

409.description: The submitted workflow version has the same name and version as an existing workflow version, but the submitted workflow script/accessory workflow scripts/outputs/parameters do not match the existing workflow version.

get.description: List workflows that are available to be run. The client must do additional work to determine which of these workflows can be run with which target and what information is requred to do that.

200.description: The list of workflows that is available
